structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS

law.catch_line: Circumstances under which coroner may order body exhumed.
law.text: A coroner may, upon receipt of an affidavit from any person stating that he believes or has reasonable grounds to believe that a person who is dead and buried died from poisoning or other illegal cause, order the body exhumed and a post-mortem examination or autopsy conducted.
law.history: Created 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 93, sec. 12, effective June 17, 1978.
